definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
careless, negligent, slipshod/see 邋遢[la1 ta5]

sentences.english: People expected revolutionaries to be bearded and unkempt .
sentences.chinese: 人们认为革命者都是满脸胡须，邋里邋遢的。

sentences.english: She will not allow anyone to see her dressed down.
sentences.chinese: 她不会让别人看到她邋里邋遢的一面。

sentences.english: Some flat mates are neat and tidy while others are very messy.
sentences.chinese: 有些室友干净整洁，而有些则很邋里邋遢。

sentences.english: They can get away with looking like unkempt college students.
sentences.chinese: 看上去像个邋里邋遢的大学生也无所谓。

definition: not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress

lit. to present oneself confidently to the emperor, without makeup (as did the sister of Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]) (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) to show one's natural features, without makeup/to present oneself just as one is, without artifice
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
to make a show of being decent and proper/to display phony or hypocritical behavior
